segments.en: And today we're bringing you another great lesson for all of you who are interested in shopping.
segments.cn: 今天我们为所有对购物感兴趣的你们带来另一堂精彩课程。

segments.en: Especially those of you who are interested in shopping for a car.
segments.cn: 特别是那些对买车感兴趣的你们。

segments.en: So we're going to give you some great language about describing a car or characteristics of a car.
segments.cn: 所以我们将给你们一些关于描述汽车或汽车特征的好词汇。

segments.en: And also some really interesting language for shopping.
segments.cn: 还有一些非常有趣的购物用语。

segments.en: Yes, especially buying something really big and expensive.
segments.cn: 是的，特别是购买一些非常大且昂贵的东西。

segments.en: So before we listen to our dialogue, let's take a look at vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 在我们听对话之前，先来看一下词汇预览。

segments.en: On vocabulary preview today we're bringing you two words.
segments.cn: 今天的词汇预览我们带来两个词。

segments.en: So again, a vehicle is a machine, right?
Right, a machine that carries people from one place to another.
segments.cn: 对，是一种将人从一个地方运送到另一个地方的机器。

segments.en: So it's important to say that a vehicle could be an airplane, a car, a boat, even a bicycle.
segments.cn: 所以重要的是要说，车辆可以是飞机、汽车、船，甚至是自行车。
我们的第二个词是轿车。

segments.en: So a sedan is a type of car.
It's a type of car with four doors that can fit five people inside.
segments.cn: 它是一种有四个门的汽车，可以容纳五个人。

segments.en: So to make it more clear, most taxis are sedans.
segments.cn: 为了更清楚地说明，大多数出租车是轿车。

segments.en: They have four doors, five people can fit in there including the driver.
segments.cn: 它们有四个门，五个人可以坐进去，包括司机。

segments.en: They're Volkswagen beetles, so those are not sedans.
segments.cn: 它们是大众甲壳虫，所以那些不是轿车。

segments.en: But yeah, most countries have sedans as taxis.
segments.cn: 但大多数国家的出租车是轿车。

segments.en: To give you some examples, like a Toyota Corolla or a Toyota Camry is a sedan.
segments.cn: 给你一些例子，比如丰田卡罗拉或丰田凯美瑞是轿车。

segments.en: Yeah, a Jetta is a sedan.
Now we can listen to our dialogue and it's going to be at a normal speed the first time, but you don't have to worry about it.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以听我们的对话，第一次会以正常速度进行，但你不必担心。

segments.en: We'll come back and teach you some of the important words from the dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们会回来教你一些对话中的重要词汇。

segments.en: Hi there, can I help you folks?
segments.cn: 你好，有什么可以帮你的吗？

segments.en: I'm just browsing, seeing what's on the lot.
segments.cn: 我只是随便看看，看看车场上有什么。

segments.en: My daughter wants a car for her birthday.
segments.cn: 我女儿想要一辆车作为生日礼物。

segments.en: Dad, I'm 16 already and I'm like the only one at school who doesn't have a car.
segments.cn: 爸爸，我已经16岁了，学校里几乎只有我没有车。

segments.en: Kids these days all have cars.
Let me show you something we just got in.
segments.cn: 让我给你展示一下我们刚到的一辆车。

segments.en: It has dual air bags and anti-light brakes.
segments.cn: 它有双气囊和防抱死刹车。

segments.en: A perfect vehicle for a young driver.
segments.cn: 对年轻司机来说是完美的车辆。

segments.en: Can we get this one please?
What can you tell me about this one?
segments.cn: 你能告诉我关于这辆车的更多信息吗？

segments.en: Oh, that's just an old World War II tank that we use for TV commercials.
segments.cn: 哦，那只是我们用来拍电视广告的二战坦克。

segments.en: Tell me more about this tank.
segments.cn: 告诉我更多关于这辆坦克的事。

segments.en: Well sir, if you are looking for quality and safety then look no further.
segments.cn: 好吧，先生，如果你在寻找质量和安全，那就不用再找了。

segments.en: Three inches of reinforced steel protect your daughter from short range missile attacks.
segments.cn: 三英寸的加固钢材可以保护你的女儿免受短程导弹攻击。

segments.en: Does the sedan protect her from missile attacks?
segments.cn: 轿车能保护她免受导弹攻击吗？

segments.en: Did I mention the tank is a tank?
segments.cn: 我提到过这辆坦克是坦克吗？

segments.en: She's getting a tank to go to school.
I would be so embarrassed if I had to drive to school in a tank.
segments.cn: 如果我必须开坦克去上学，我会感到非常尴尬。

segments.en: Alright, a surprising ending to a relatively easy shopping day.
segments.cn: 好吧，购物日的意外结局。

segments.en: Let's take a look at some language that we saw in our dialogue on language takeaway.
segments.cn: 让我们看看在对话中看到的一些语言，语言总结。

segments.en: We have four words for you today.
segments.cn: 今天我们有四个词给你。

segments.en: The first one is gas mileage.
So gas mileage is how many miles you can travel on a gallon or liter of gasoline.
segments.cn: 所以油耗是你可以用一加仑或一升汽油行驶的英里数。
嗯，你知道有什么有趣的事吗？

segments.en: In some English-speaking countries like Australia, New Zealand, Canada, we use kilometers to measure distance, but we still talk about gas mileage.
segments.cn: 在一些英语国家，比如澳大利亚、新西兰、加拿大，我们用公里来测量距离，但我们仍然谈论油耗。

segments.en: I guess you can't say gas kilo mileage.
segments.cn: 我想你不能说油公里耗。

segments.en: But yeah, it's yeah basically how many kilometers or how many miles you can travel on a tank or on a liter or gallon of gas.
segments.cn: 但基本上，这就是你能在一箱油或一升或一加仑汽油上行驶多少公里或多少英里。

segments.en: These are like big bags of air that fill up and come out of the car when there's a crash.
segments.cn: 这些就像是大气囊，在发生碰撞时会充气并从车内弹出。

segments.en: Right, so that way you don't hit your head against the steering wheel or something like that.
segments.cn: 对，这样你就不会撞到方向盘或其他东西。

segments.en: I've heard that Volvo has like 18 airbags now in their cars.
segments.cn: 我听说沃尔沃现在在他们的车上有18个安全气囊。

segments.en: They are very safe cars, you know.
segments.cn: 它们是非常安全的车，你知道的。

segments.en: Okay, our third word today is brakes.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们的第三个词是刹车。

segments.en: Brakes are little... what are brakes?
segments.cn: 刹车是小... 刹车是什么？

segments.en: Brakes are what make your car stop.
segments.cn: 刹车是让你的车停下来的东西。

segments.en: Okay, so they're the little machines maybe that stop your car?
segments.cn: 好的，所以它们可能是让你的车停下来的小机器？

segments.en: Yeah, they make your car stop.
segments.cn: 是的，它们让你的车停下。

segments.en: You have brakes on your bike.
segments.cn: 你的自行车上也有刹车。

segments.en: Our last word today on language takeaway, reinforced.
segments.cn: 我们今天最后一个词是加固。

segments.en: So we have some examples of how we use reinforced because it's a little bit weird.
segments.cn: 我们有一些加固的用法示例，因为这有点奇怪。

segments.en: Yeah, these will help you understand the meaning.
segments.cn: 是的，这些会帮助你理解意思。

segments.en: So I reinforced all the walls.
There's no way they're gonna fall down.
This plastic is reinforced with a glass so it's both light and strong.
segments.cn: 这种塑料是用玻璃加固的，所以它既轻又坚固。

segments.en: So basically anything that's reinforced is made stronger.
segments.cn: 所以基本上任何被加固的东西都是更坚固的。
加固钢，加固桌子，任何东西。

segments.en: So now we could listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以再听一遍我们的对话。

segments.en: You can practice all these words that we just talked about and we'll come back shortly.
segments.cn: 你可以练习我们刚刚讨论的所有这些词，我们很快会回来。

segments.en: I'm just browsing, seeing what's on the lot.
segments.cn: 我只是随便看看，看看车场上有什么。

segments.en: My daughter wants a car for her birthday.
segments.cn: 我女儿想要一辆车作为生日礼物。

segments.en: Dad, I'm 16 already and I'm like the only one at school who doesn't have a car.
segments.cn: 爸爸，我已经16岁了，我是学校里唯一没有车的人。

segments.en: She is Let me show you something we just got in.
segments.cn: 她是。让我给你展示我们刚刚到的一辆。

segments.en: It has dual airbags and anti-lock brakes.
segments.cn: 它有双安全气囊和防抱死刹车。

segments.en: A perfect vehicle for a young driver.
segments.cn: 对于年轻司机来说是完美的车辆。

segments.en: Can we get this one please?
What can you tell me about this one?
segments.cn: 你能告诉我关于这辆车的事吗？

segments.en: Oh, that's just an old World War II tank that we use for TV commercials.
segments.cn: 哦，那只是我们用来拍电视广告的旧二战坦克。

segments.en: Tell me more about this tank.
segments.cn: 告诉我更多关于这辆坦克的事。

segments.en: Well, sir, if you are looking for quality and safety, then look no further.
segments.cn: 好吧，先生，如果你在寻找质量和安全，那就不用再看了。

segments.en: Three inches of reinforced steel protect your daughter from short-range missile attacks.
segments.cn: 三英寸的加固钢保护你的女儿免受短程导弹攻击。

segments.en: Does the sedan protect her from missile attacks?
segments.cn: 轿车能保护她免受导弹攻击吗？

segments.en: Did I mention the tank is a tank?
segments.cn: 我提到过这辆坦克是坦克吗？

segments.en: So, we have a couple of interesting phrases to talk about shopping.
segments.cn: 所以，我们有几个有趣的短语来谈论购物。

segments.en: Let's look at these in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 让我们在流利度构建器中看看这些。

segments.en: The first one today is, I'm just browsing.
segments.cn: 今天第一个是，我只是随便看看。

segments.en: This is a really useful phrase because usually sales people will come up to you and ask you, can I help you?
segments.cn: 这是一个非常有用的短语，因为通常销售人员会走过来问你，能帮你吗？

segments.en: Yeah, maybe you don't really want to buy.
segments.cn: 是的，也许你并不真的想买。

segments.en: So you're just, I'm just browsing.
segments.cn: 所以你只是，我只是随便看看。

segments.en: So then they'll just leave you alone.
segments.cn: 这样他们就会让你一个人待着。

segments.en: They won't bother you as much.
segments.cn: 他们不会打扰你那么多。

segments.en: So we have some examples of how you sleep on it.
segments.cn: 所以我们有一些关于如何想一想的例子。

segments.en: I don't know if we should buy that house.
segments.cn: 我不知道我们是否应该买那栋房子。

segments.en: It's perfect for us, but it's so expensive.
segments.cn: 对我们来说很完美，但太贵了。

segments.en: Why don't you sleep on it and tell me tomorrow?
segments.cn: 你为什么不想一想，明天告诉我？

segments.en: This is a bit more than what I can afford.
segments.cn: 这有点超出我的承受能力。

segments.en: To sleep on it means to like to think about it overnight to think about it.
segments.cn: 想一想意味着过夜考虑一下。

segments.en: So maybe you want to buy this really expensive car, but you need to think about it.
segments.cn: 所以也许你想买这辆非常贵的车，但你需要考虑一下。

segments.en: So yeah, you go home, sleep on it, think about it twice and then make a decision.
segments.cn: 所以是的，你回家，想一想，考虑两次，然后做决定。
很好的话和很好的对话。

segments.en: So we could listen to it again, and then we'll come back and talk a little bit about it.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以再听一遍，然后再回来聊聊。

segments.en: I'm just browsing, seeing what's on the lot.
segments.cn: 我只是浏览一下，看看有什么车。

segments.en: My daughter wants a car for her birthday.
segments.cn: 我女儿想要一辆生日车。

segments.en: And I'm like the only one at school who doesn't have a car.
segments.cn: 我在学校几乎是唯一没有车的人。

segments.en: You know, kids these days all have cars.
segments.cn: 你知道，现在的孩子们都有车。

segments.en: Let me show you something we just got in a 1996 sedan.
segments.cn: 让我给你们看看我们刚到的一辆1996年轿车。

segments.en: It has dual airbags and anti-lock brakes.
segments.cn: 它有双气囊和防抱死刹车。

segments.en: A perfect vehicle for a young driver.
segments.cn: 对年轻司机来说是完美的车辆。

segments.en: Can we get this one please?
What can you tell me about this one?
segments.cn: 你能告诉我关于这辆车的更多信息吗？

segments.en: Oh, that's just an old World War Two tank that we use for TV commercials.
segments.cn: 哦，那只是我们用来拍电视广告的二战老坦克。

segments.en: Tell me more about this tank.
segments.cn: 告诉我更多关于这辆坦克的事。

segments.en: Well, sir, if you are looking for quality and safety, then look no further.
segments.cn: 好吧，先生，如果你在寻找质量和安全，那就不用再找了。

segments.en: Three inches of reinforced steel protect your daughter from short range missile attacks.
segments.cn: 三英寸的加固钢材保护你的女儿免受短程导弹攻击。

segments.en: Does the sedan protect her from missile attacks?
segments.cn: 轿车能保护她免受导弹攻击吗？

segments.en: Did I mention the tank is a tank?
segments.cn: 我提到过坦克是坦克吗？

segments.en: So, Marco, have you ever driven a tank?
Well, I mean, I know you're in the army, so... Yeah, actually I did.
segments.cn: 嗯，我是说，我知道你在军队，所以……是的，实际上我开过。

segments.en: I did drive a tank before.
Kind of like a World War Two type tank.
segments.cn: 有点像二战时期的坦克。

segments.en: But yeah, they're really fun and interesting.
It's not like driving a normal car.
segments.cn: 开起来和普通车不一样。

segments.en: You have pedals and... So there's no steering wheel?
segments.cn: 你有踏板……所以没有方向盘？

segments.en: And what many people don't know is that actually tanks are manual transmissions.
segments.cn: 而且很多人不知道的是，坦克实际上是手动变速器。

segments.en: It's really hard to change gears on those things.
segments.cn: 在那些东西上换挡真的很难。

segments.en: And what's the gas mileage like in a tank?
Maybe like five miles per gallon.
They run on diesel, which is a different type of fuel, right?
segments.cn: 它们使用柴油，这是一种不同类型的燃料，对吗？

segments.en: I never knew that my podcast partner had driven a tank.
segments.cn: 我从来不知道我的播客搭档开过坦克。

segments.en: Yeah, well, it was fun, definitely.
And I hope I get to do it again someday.
segments.cn: 我希望有一天能再开一次。

segments.en: Well, guys, have you ever driven a tank?
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，你们开过坦克吗？

segments.en: Or a submarine or any type of armored vehicle?
segments.cn: 或潜艇或任何类型的装甲车？

segments.en: Yeah, tell us about it at our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 是的，在我们的网站EnglishPod.com告诉我们。

segments.en: Right, we'll be there to answer all your questions.
segments.cn: 对，我们会在那里回答你们所有的问题。

segments.en: I'll also be there to maybe post some more crazy stories.
segments.cn: 我也会在那里发布一些疯狂的故事。

segments.en: Or some pictures of a tank or something.
segments.cn: 或者一些坦克的照片之类的。

segments.en: All right, guys, we'll see you there.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，我们在那里见。
